alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island; Ocracoke Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 09 at 4:01AM EST until January 11 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 3 PM EST WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT EST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, 2 to 4 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 10 to 18 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Ocracoke Island and Hatteras Island. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Warning, from 11 AM Tuesday to 3 PM EST Wednesday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 11 AM Tuesday to midnight EST Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...2 to 4 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a threat of property damage. Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Moderate to significant ocean overwash is likely, mainly from Oregon Inlet to Ocracoke. This will likely impact portions of Highway 12, which may be impassable at times, especially around times of high tide. High tide is around 5:30 PM Tuesday and 6 AM Wednesday. Moderate to significant beach erosion expected, along with very rough surf. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Both soundside and oceanside flooding is expected Tuesday into Wednesday. Be alert for rapid water level rises Tuesday night and early Wednesday on the soundside as winds shift to the southwest and west.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
